meanings.def: including the most important aspects of something; not exact or detailed
examples: I check the bookings to get a general idea of what activities to plan.
I know how it works in general terms.
They gave a general description of the man.
Carton here uses the word ‘business’ in a very general sense.

meanings.def: approximately, but not exactly, the direction/area mentioned
examples: They fired in the general direction of the enemy.

meanings.def: not limited to a particular subject, use or activity
examples: a general hospital
general education
We shall keep the discussion fairly general.

meanings.def: not limited to one part or aspect of a person or thing
examples: a general anaesthetic
The building was in a general state of disrepair.
the general manager
the Inspector General of Police

meanings.def: Charles George Gordon (1833-85) an English military leader. He became known as 'Chinese Gordon' after defeating a rebellion against British rule in China in 1863. He was killed in a small military camp in Khartoum, Sudan, after resisting attacks from Sudanese forces for ten months.
